TI_DOC.P: EIB - Construction of water supply systems (MW-Mzuzu)

CONTENTS.P: 1— This invitation for prequalification applications is for the Malawi NRWB Water Efficiency Project.

2— The Government of the Republic of Malawi has obtained a credit from the European Investment Bank, hereinafter referred to as “the Bank”. The Northern Region Water Board, hereinafter referred to as “the Employer”, intends to apply part of the proceeds of the credit towards the cost of contract nº NRWB/MZUZU/W01: Construction of priority works (I) Ekwendeni Water Treatment Plant (II) Mzuzu Reservoirs.
3— The employer intends to prequalify firms and consortia to tender for the above-mentioned contract, hereinafter referred to as “the Contract”.
4— Background Information
The Mzuzu and Ekwendeni water supply systems are two of the ten water supply systems that are managed by the Northern Region Water Board.

The source of water for Mzuzu City, Ekwendeni Town and the surrounding areas is the Lunyangwa Dam (with a small amount of the water supplied to Ekwendeni abstracted from the Lunyangwa River near Ekwendeni). The capacity of Lunyangwa Dam has, however, been surpassed by the current water demand. In the long term, the solution to this challenge is construction of an additional dam.

However, being a major construction undertaking, construction of an additional dam will take several years to be accomplished. Noting that the capacity of the existing dam is already exceeded by the current water demand, there is need for quick interventions which will sustain the water supply to Mzuzu City, Ekwendeni Town and the surrounding areas while funds for construction of an additional dam are being sourced and, thereafter, during construction of the dam. The quick interventions have already been designed and are ready for construction.
The works will involve supply of materials, installation and construction of:
In Ekwendeni
Water treatment plant with 13,200m3/day capacity consisting of the following components:
— 180 m long DI raw water pumping pipeline (400mm diameter),
— 2 nº reinforced concrete settling tanks,
— 1 nº reinforced concrete mixing basin,
— 4 nº reinforced concrete flocculation units,
— 4 nº reinforced concrete sedimentation tanks,
— 3 nº reinforced concrete rapid gravity filters,
— Chemical dosing system,
— Filter backwash system,
— 1 nº clear water reinforced concrete tank, 500m3 capacity,
— 3 nº pumps to convey water to a storage tank,
— 2 nº backwash pumps,
— 3,5 km long PVC clear water pumping pipeline (315 mm diameter).
In Mzuzu
— 3 nº pressed steel elevated tanks, 500m3 capacity,
— 1 nº ground-level pressed steel or reinforced concrete tank, 2 000 m3 capacity,
— 4 nº ground-level pressed steel or reinforced concrete tanks, 1 000 m3 capacity.
The estimated supply and installation period is 18 months.
5— The criteria that will be used in the evaluation of the applications are:
5.1 Submission of all requested information:
applications will be examined to confirm that all the requested documents and information have been provided, and to determine the completeness of each document submitted.
5.2 Eligibility:
the following eligibility criteria will apply. In the case of applications submitted by a joint venture, these eligibility and qualification criteria will be applied to the joint venture as a whole:
a— applicants may have the nationality of any country, subject to certain restrictions detailed in the prequalification document,
b— applicants shall not have a conflict of interest,
c— applicants shall not have been declared ineligible by the bank,
d— Government Owned Entities may only participate if they satisfy certain requirements that are detailed in the prequalification document.
5.3 Historical contract non-performance:
a— non-performance of a contract did not occur as a result of contractor’s default since 1.1.2015.
b— not under suspension based on execution of a bid securing declaration by employer
c— no consistent history of court /arbitral award decisions against the applicant since 1.1.2015.
5.4 Financial situation and performance
The applicant shall furnish documentary evidence that it meets the following financial requirement(s):
a— the applicant shall demonstrate that it is able to meet a cash flow requirement of at least EUR 1 500 000 for the contract net of the applicant’s other commitments,

b— the applicant shall submit audited balance sheets, or other financial statements acceptable to the employer, for the last 3 years (2015, 2016 and 2017) that demonstrate the current soundness of the applicant’s financial position and indicate its prospective long-term profitability,

c— an applicant that is subject to pending litigation shall be able to demonstrate that its financial position and prospective long-term profitability will remain sound if all pending litigation is resolved against it,

d— the applicant shall also demonstrate, to the satisfaction of the employer, that it has achieved a minimum average annual turnover of EUR 7 000 000, calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress and /or completed, during the last 3 years (2015, 2016 and 2017).
5.5 Experience:
General experience

Applicants shall have had experience under contracts in the role of prime contractor for at least the last 3 years, starting 1.1.2015 (in the case of a joint venture, each member must meet this requirement).
Specific construction experience

Applicants shall, as a prime contractor, have satisfactorily and substantially completed at least one similar contract with a minimum value of EUR 7 000 000 or at least two similar contracts with minimum values of EUR 4 000 000 each between 1.1.2013 and the application submission deadline.

6— Subject to satisfying the eligibility requirements in 5.2 above, prequalification and tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of the credit from the bank is open to firms and joint ventures of firms from any country.

7— Prequalification documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a non-refundable fee of MWK 80 000 or EUR 100 or equivalent in a convertible currency. The method of payment will be cash or bank certified cheque tendered at the northern region water board cash office.
8— A prospective applicant may arrange to receive the Prequalification Document once payment has been receipted by the northern region water board.
9— If requested, the documents can be dispatched electronically in PDF format free of charge.

10— The prequalification documents must be duly completed and delivered to the address below before 14:00 hours on or before 27.4.2018. Documents which are received late will be rejected and returned unopened.
11— Applications will be opened in the presence of applicants’ representatives who choose to attend at 14:00 hours on 27.4.2018 at the address below.
12— Interested firms may obtain further information from, and inspect and acquire the prequalification documents at the following office:
a— For inspection and clarification on the documents
The Acting Director of technical services
Northern Region Water Board,
Private Bag 94, Mzuzu.

ungwe@nrwb.org.mw

2— The Government of the Republic of Malawi has obtained a credit from the European Investment Bank, hereinafter referred to as “the Bank”. The Northern Region Water Board, hereinafter referred to as “the Employer”, intends to apply part of the proceeds of the credit towards the cost of contract nº NRWB/MZUZU/W01: Construction of priority works (I) Ekwendeni Water Treatment Plant (II) Mzuzu Reservoirs.
3— The employer intends to prequalify firms and consortia to tender for the above-mentioned contract, hereinafter referred to as “the Contract”.
4— Background Information
The Mzuzu and Ekwendeni water supply systems are two of the ten water supply systems that are managed by the Northern Region Water Board.

The source of water for Mzuzu City, Ekwendeni Town and the surrounding areas is the Lunyangwa Dam (with a small amount of the water supplied to Ekwendeni abstracted from the Lunyangwa River near Ekwendeni). The capacity of Lunyangwa Dam has, however, been surpassed by the current water demand. In the long term, the solution to this challenge is construction of an additional dam.

However, being a major construction undertaking, construction of an additional dam will take several years to be accomplished. Noting that the capacity of the existing dam is already exceeded by the current water demand, there is need for quick interventions which will sustain the water supply to Mzuzu City, Ekwendeni Town and the surrounding areas while funds for construction of an additional dam are being sourced and, thereafter, during construction of the dam. The quick interventions have already been designed and are ready for construction.
The works will involve supply of materials, installation and construction of:
In Ekwendeni
Water treatment plant with 13,200m3/day capacity consisting of the following components:
— 180 m long DI raw water pumping pipeline (400mm diameter),
— 2 nº reinforced concrete settling tanks,
— 1 nº reinforced concrete mixing basin,
— 4 nº reinforced concrete flocculation units,
— 4 nº reinforced concrete sedimentation tanks,
— 3 nº reinforced concrete rapid gravity filters,
— Chemical dosing system,
— Filter backwash system,
— 1 nº clear water reinforced concrete tank, 500m3 capacity,
— 3 nº pumps to convey water to a storage tank,
— 2 nº backwash pumps,
— 3,5 km long PVC clear water pumping pipeline (315 mm diameter).
In Mzuzu
— 3 nº pressed steel elevated tanks, 500m3 capacity,
— 1 nº ground-level pressed steel or reinforced concrete tank, 2 000 m3 capacity,
— 4 nº ground-level pressed steel or reinforced concrete tanks, 1 000 m3 capacity.
The estimated supply and installation period is 18 months.
5— The criteria that will be used in the evaluation of the applications are:
5.1 Submission of all requested information:
applications will be examined to confirm that all the requested documents and information have been provided, and to determine the completeness of each document submitted.
5.2 Eligibility:
the following eligibility criteria will apply. In the case of applications submitted by a joint venture, these eligibility and qualification criteria will be applied to the joint venture as a whole:
a— applicants may have the nationality of any country, subject to certain restrictions detailed in the prequalification document,
b— applicants shall not have a conflict of interest,
c— applicants shall not have been declared ineligible by the bank,
d— Government Owned Entities may only participate if they satisfy certain requirements that are detailed in the prequalification document.
5.3 Historical contract non-performance:
a— non-performance of a contract did not occur as a result of contractor’s default since 1.1.2015.
b— not under suspension based on execution of a bid securing declaration by employer
c— no consistent history of court /arbitral award decisions against the applicant since 1.1.2015.
5.4 Financial situation and performance
The applicant shall furnish documentary evidence that it meets the following financial requirement(s):
a— the applicant shall demonstrate that it is able to meet a cash flow requirement of at least EUR 1 500 000 for the contract net of the applicant’s other commitments,

b— the applicant shall submit audited balance sheets, or other financial statements acceptable to the employer, for the last 3 years (2015, 2016 and 2017) that demonstrate the current soundness of the applicant’s financial position and indicate its prospective long-term profitability,

c— an applicant that is subject to pending litigation shall be able to demonstrate that its financial position and prospective long-term profitability will remain sound if all pending litigation is resolved against it,

d— the applicant shall also demonstrate, to the satisfaction of the employer, that it has achieved a minimum average annual turnover of EUR 7 000 000, calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress and /or completed, during the last 3 years (2015, 2016 and 2017).
5.5 Experience:
General experience

Applicants shall have had experience under contracts in the role of prime contractor for at least the last 3 years, starting 1.1.2015 (in the case of a joint venture, each member must meet this requirement).
Specific construction experience

Applicants shall, as a prime contractor, have satisfactorily and substantially completed at least one similar contract with a minimum value of EUR 7 000 000 or at least two similar contracts with minimum values of EUR 4 000 000 each between 1.1.2013 and the application submission deadline.

6— Subject to satisfying the eligibility requirements in 5.2 above, prequalification and tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of the credit from the bank is open to firms and joint ventures of firms from any country.

7— Prequalification documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a non-refundable fee of MWK 80 000 or EUR 100 or equivalent in a convertible currency. The method of payment will be cash or bank certified cheque tendered at the northern region water board cash office.
8— A prospective applicant may arrange to receive the Prequalification Document once payment has been receipted by the northern region water board.
9— If requested, the documents can be dispatched electronically in PDF format free of charge.

10— The prequalification documents must be duly completed and delivered to the address below before 14:00 hours on or before 27.4.2018. Documents which are received late will be rejected and returned unopened.
11— Applications will be opened in the presence of applicants’ representatives who choose to attend at 14:00 hours on 27.4.2018 at the address below.
12— Interested firms may obtain further information from, and inspect and acquire the prequalification documents at the following office:

Private Bag 94, Mzuzu.

CONTENTS.P: 1— This invitation for prequalification applications is for the Malawi NRWB Water Efficiency Project.

2— The Government of the Republic of Malawi has obtained a credit from the European Investment Bank, hereinafter referred to as “the Bank”. The Northern Region Water Board, hereinafter referred to as “the Employer”, intends to apply part of the proceeds of the credit towards the cost of contract nº NRWB/MZUZU/W01: Construction of priority works (I) Ekwendeni Water Treatment Plant (II) Mzuzu Reservoirs.
3— The employer intends to prequalify firms and consortia to tender for the above-mentioned contract, hereinafter referred to as “the Contract”.
4— Background Information
The Mzuzu and Ekwendeni water supply systems are two of the ten water supply systems that are managed by the Northern Region Water Board.

The source of water for Mzuzu City, Ekwendeni Town and the surrounding areas is the Lunyangwa Dam (with a small amount of the water supplied to Ekwendeni abstracted from the Lunyangwa River near Ekwendeni). The capacity of Lunyangwa Dam has, however, been surpassed by the current water demand. In the long term, the solution to this challenge is construction of an additional dam.

However, being a major construction undertaking, construction of an additional dam will take several years to be accomplished. Noting that the capacity of the existing dam is already exceeded by the current water demand, there is need for quick interventions which will sustain the water supply to Mzuzu City, Ekwendeni Town and the surrounding areas while funds for construction of an additional dam are being sourced and, thereafter, during construction of the dam. The quick interventions have already been designed and are ready for construction.
The works will involve supply of materials, installation and construction of:
In Ekwendeni
Water treatment plant with 13,200m3/day capacity consisting of the following components:
— 180 m long DI raw water pumping pipeline (400mm diameter),
— 2 nº reinforced concrete settling tanks,
— 1 nº reinforced concrete mixing basin,
— 4 nº reinforced concrete flocculation units,
— 4 nº reinforced concrete sedimentation tanks,
— 3 nº reinforced concrete rapid gravity filters,
— Chemical dosing system,
— Filter backwash system,
— 1 nº clear water reinforced concrete tank, 500m3 capacity,
— 3 nº pumps to convey water to a storage tank,
— 2 nº backwash pumps,
— 3,5 km long PVC clear water pumping pipeline (315 mm diameter).
In Mzuzu
— 3 nº pressed steel elevated tanks, 500m3 capacity,
— 1 nº ground-level pressed steel or reinforced concrete tank, 2 000 m3 capacity,
— 4 nº ground-level pressed steel or reinforced concrete tanks, 1 000 m3 capacity.
The estimated supply and installation period is 18 months.
